result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Reinert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Bond shall be applied towards the restitution.   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim, Kyle Klink or the victims residence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Reinert

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. On a plea to Ct. 2, State moves to dismiss Ct. 1 for read in.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2; Court dismisses Ct 1 for read in. Joint recommendation. Court finds defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction.  Argument from State, Defense; Court proceeds to sentencing.    Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Plea hearing at 01-06-2016 02:45 pm

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Adjourned to allow Defendant to pay restitution.  If no resolution, matter to be set for trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
